body:
Hi, the situation as follow:
Apisix serves as a portal to multiple systems, with different domain names for different systems and the same path for different domain names/systems.now,we use skywalking to be a APM system,how to distinguish endpoints.
for example,I have two url like http://www.bbb.com/add and http://www.aaa.com/add, they both are in Apisix.But in Skywalking,they both shows /add.

First, I am not an expertise of APISIX, is this a common usage? @moonming @Miss-you ?

Currently, we only use `uri` as the span's operation name, which is the source of your endpoint.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nginx-lua/blob/0795297970f1cab01558ec1787499b6a5eef5233/lib/skywalking/tracer.lua#L46
Could you check the graphql to see whether the data is correct from the backend?

I think the error is very clear
```
Caused by: javax.security.auth.login.LoginException: unable to find LoginModule class: org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext.invoke(LoginContext.java:794)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext.access$000(LoginContext.java:195)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext$4.run(LoginContext.java:682)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext$4.run(LoginContext.java:680)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext.invokePriv(LoginContext.java:680)
at javax.security.auth.login.LoginContext.login(LoginContext.java:587)
```

Class isn't found. Do Kafka or your JDK require to add some jars in the class loader? We should release codes with `javax.*`.

This is my configuration in agent.config:
plugin.kafka.producer_config[sasl.jaas.config]=org.apache.kafka.common.security.plain.PlainLoginModule required \
username="xxx" \
password="***";
plugin.kafka.producer_config[sasl.mechanism]=PLAIN
plugin.kafka.producer_config[security.protocol]=SASL_SSL
plugin.kafka.producer_config[ssl.truststore.location]=/xxx/skywalking/agent/config/client.truststore.jks
plugin.kafka.producer_config[ssl.truststore.password]=***
plugin.kafka.producer_config[ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm]=
but the class PlainLoginModule is found in kafka-clients-2.4.1.jar
I think this is out of SkyWalking's scope. This is a Kafka side solution. Read their documents, to see how to use this in Kafka directly.
Could you provide a link about Dubbo document of group?

#6159 
this is my PR.
We need to take a look what is Dubbo group first. The implementation could wait for a while.

Thanks .
Introduce In Chinese :
服务分组，当一个接口有多个实现，可以用分组区分


 Dubbo group introduce doc is

[http://dubbo.apache.org/zh/docs/v2.7/user/references/xml/dubbo-provider/](http://dubbo.apache.org/zh/docs/v2.7/user/references/xml/dubbo-provider/)

please search keywords "group" in this link page

Backend is storing the data UC + 5 (OAP Server Time Zone UC+5) where I need to store it on UC+5:50 (IST) time. Where I can change this. 
Thanks and Regards,
Jayesh Muley
That is JVM Time Zone setting. We don't control that. But currently UI doesn't support UTC +5.5 I am afraid.

@arugal The query protocol updated. Please follow that.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-query-protocol/blob/4ac87d563213a2ff70039afc0b7a5a4815878bbd/log.graphqls#L58-L61

> I don't think there's a duplicate, the scope of the agent side is a single instance, and the scope of the backend is the entire system. Both of them can exist.

That is another thing I want to discuss. The current implementation has performance concern. Because basically, ignorance should be service-oriented. For this feature, we need to be very carefully about the performance impact. 
Because `cost` * N agent instances ==> `cost` of M OAP instances. N is much bigger than M.
And once you have the rules across services, the rules must check all endpoints of all services.

> use `uri`

`local entrySpan = TC.createEntrySpan(tracingContext, ngx.var.uri, nil, contextCarrier)`

> use `domain` + `uri`

`local entrySpan = TC.createEntrySpan(tracingContext, ngx.var.host .. "/" .. ngx.var.uri, nil, contextCarrier)`

I removed the 8.4.0 for now, as we don't have the VM concept for now. FYI @wankai123 , this depends on your side process.

@mrproliu @wankai123 I was thinking about the VM entity for a while, when you were adopting the protocol/format.
I think as far as we have adopt the group concept in the naming format, we could simply use `vm::`/`network::`/etc. as the standard prefix when we need to monitor infra entities. All VM or network entity could be treated as service. By that, we don't need to add the VM concept in the core, which impacts the query, which is very complex. 
Also, we could support VM level topology once we have the data.

WDYT?
